Fields.DialogueText: This ocean is too salty! You know what this ocean needs? A little more tuaca!
Someone's been imbibing for a while now, I see.
Oh, Capitano! Get over here!
Wait...
What is it? You're glaring at me, Camicia.
Has anyone ever told you that you have a nice face? Proportionally speaking.

Fields.MenuText: I get it all the time actually.
No, I can honestly say that I've never heard that before.
Only from my mother, but I think she's biased.

Fields.DialogueText: I bet. I find your face, *hiccup* very well made, Capitano. It's a very good face.
What a shame. With a face like yours, you should, *hiccup* hear it all the time.
Hah, your mother. You're, *hiccup* funny, Capitano.
Come here, I wanna rub your face...
Okay, when you start rubbing faces, I think you've had enough to drink.
No. My Tuaca. I've only just started.
If that were true, you wouldn't be acting like a completely different person.
*ALARM*
Oh, you hear that?! Challengers approach. They're after my Tuaca!
No, I'm the one trying to get that away from you.
To war, Capitano! War for Tuaca!
Well, I guess no matter how drunk she gets, she still hungers for battle.
But does she...  really think I'm good looking?
@BATTLE
Ugh, Capitano, I think I drank too much.
What was your first clue? The headache or all the empty bottles?
The blackout. I have to drink a hell of a lot before I start forgetting stuff.
You don't remember anything?
No. So fill me in. I didn't do anything stupid, did I?

Fields.MenuText: No, nothing stupid at all. You were completely yourself.
It's a shame you don't remember that we fought and killed the biggest Morganas I've ever seen!
You... may have called me good looking.

Fields.DialogueText: That's a relief. I don't usually get that drunk, but when I do, I'm told I can be unpredictable.
And what happened next? Did we kill a unicorn? I'm not in the mood for jokes with this hangover.
I what?! No, you must've misheard me. I'd never do something so... so...
How about we just say nothing happened? That might be best for everyone.
... You might be right. Yeah, let's do that. Anything I may or may not have said, should be forgotten.
I hear you loud and clear.
*ALARM*
Bastards! I told them not to sound the alarm!
And I told them to ignore you. Remember this next time you decide to drink too much.
If I wasn't in so much pain right now, I'd make you all pay.
@BATTLE
I'm sick of patrolling, Capitano. I demand we go on a hunt.
A hunt? What are you talking about?
It's about time we track down another worthy foe. Like the beast we fell while we were playing bodyguard.

Fields.MenuText: You mean the beasts that nearly ripped us in two?
That's not the worst idea in the world. The Morganas have been few and far between recently.
Patrolling is an important duty, Camicia. It's integral to the war effort.

Fields.DialogueText: Yes, those ones. The ones we defeated in glorious victory. It was exhilarating.
I'm glad you agree. A climactic battle is exactly what we need.
I'm not arguing that, Capitano. I'm just saying we should look for foul beasts while we're patrolling.
Now, come on. Tell the truth. Have you heard word of any especially terrifying Morganas in nearby waters?
Not that I know of, but I can put some feelers out. See if there are any urgent requests for aid.
That's all I ask, Capitano. Oh, and we have some company.
What?
*ALARM*
Oh, that kind of company.
@BATTLE
Camicia, a word?
What is it? It better be important. I was about to get some practice at the shooting range.

Fields.MenuText: It's important, I think you'll like what you're about to hear.
Maybe this can wait. Lord knows you could use the practice.
Why are you going to the shooting range? You're a wonderful shot.

Fields.DialogueText: Oh? Is this about a big battle somewhere on the horizon?
Watch what you say, or I may just practice on a certain capitano.
Stop with the boot licking. Just spit it out.
What's so important?
Well, a contact of mine in France told me about a horde of Morganas that have been repeatedly attacking a port town. Apparently, there are a lot of them.
And Command's given us permission to investigate.
A whole horde, huh? Seems like we're heading to France then.
*ALARM*
Later rather than sooner, apparently.
A few annoyances won't take us long to dispatch. Besides, it's much better practice than the shooting range.
@BATTLE
That... doesn't look like France.

Fields.MenuText: Nope, I'm pretty sure that's France. Geography was never my best subject, though.
Nice observation. Thanks for your tremendous insight.
You're right, it's not France. We'll get there soon enough.

Fields.DialogueText: Well, I know my coastlines. And this isn't France. First clue, no Morganas.
Cut the sarcasm. It's annoying.
You say that, and yet we're still here, and not there.
No need to bite my head off, Camicia. We're just going to make a short stop for supplies. You understand that, right?
Obviously. It doesn't mean I have to be happy about it.
Wouldn't you rather face a horde of Morganas with extra ammunition in hand?
You keep saying things like that. Do you have something against my aim? I'm a fine shot!
I know you are, I...
*ALARM*
We can use what ammunition we have left to take care of those Morganas to the north.
We'll have plenty ammo left over.
... I'll believe it when I see it.
Did you say something, Capitano?!
Hey, hey, point that thing somewhere else.
I really better. My trigger finger is starting to itch.
@BATTLE
There is one good thing about resupplying, I suppose.
And what's that?
A new carton of cigarettes. I hadn't even noticed, but I was running low.

Fields.MenuText: I'm starting to think you might have a problem.
Lucky you then. Told you it was it a good idea to stop here.
Did they have that rare brand of yours?

Fields.DialogueText: A problem? The only problem I have is how expensive these are by the carton.
Yeah, you do have one of those every once in a while.
Surprisingly yes. It's a good thing too, because I doubt I'll be able to find any in France.
You should get some more of that Tuaca too. We might need to celebrate after this.
Eh, I don't think so.
Why not? I thought it was your favorite.
Oh, it is, but my head is still woozy from the last time I had it. I think I need a little more time before I get that drunk again.
Captain, we're fully stocked and the rest of the crew has come back on board.
Thank you, officer, that will be all.
Yes, Captain.
Time to head towards battle? Finally?
Seems like it. Before long, that French port town will be completely covered in a blanket of cigarette smoke.
You're less funny than you think you are.
@BATTLE
Okay, I'm starting to get a little worried.
What's wrong with you? You're shaking!
You know how bad it is out there, right? Rain and wind that could knock over a house?
Yeah, that's why we're down here.
Well, before I left, I saw Camicia Nera, and she was just leisurely strolling on the deck, wind whipping her clothes all over, a damp cigarette in her mouth. It was like she didn't care.

Fields.MenuText: So she didn't give a damn about the storm? Not exactly a surprise.
Nothing will stop her from smoking her cigarettes.
Still stalking Camicia, huh?

Fields.DialogueText: Oh, hey, Captain.
Oh, hey, Captain.
Oh, hey, Captain.
Anyway, what worried you?
Oh, right. So Camicia was just strolling about in the storm, and she was trying to light her cigarette.
Yeah, right. No spark would catch under all that rain.
Exactly, that's what I thought. Until... she lit it.
What?
I know.
What's going on over here?
Camicia, is that a... wet cigarette?
I guess it's a little damp. I'm not complaining, it works just fine.
See?
I came down to let you know that I sense some Morganas nearby. I was thinking we could make a small detour to deal with them.
Sounds like a plan.
Guys, get to work.
Yes, Captain!
@BATTLE
You're right, it's pretty much par for the course with her.
Yeah, I noticed. She screamed at me and a few of the other guys the last time she was running low. Like we could do anything about it.
I'm not stalking her. Just appreciating from a distance. No charges have been filed.
Still out here, huh?
Where else would I be?

Fields.MenuText: Your room, the mess hall, the head. A number of places, really.
The storm really doesn't bother you at all?
I guess that makes it easy to find you.

Fields.DialogueText: Well, right now, I'm here. Keeping watch while the rest of you cower from the storm.
I don't give a damn about a little rain. Though my cigarette isn't exactly a fan.
If we really needed to speak, I'd find you.
You can at least let me get you a coat or something. Just looking at you is making me shiver.
Keep your coat. It sounds like you need it more than I do.
You know, it doesn't make you weak to accept a little help. It's just me after all.
... Fine. If you really want to give me your coat, I suppose I'll accept it.
Great, I'll be right back.
And while you're doing that, sound the alarm.
Why?
There's a small group of Morganas using the storm to get closer to us than I'm comfortable with.
Taking advantage of the storm? Isn't that your move?
Yes. Now, let's show them why I'm the best at it.
@BATTLE
Looks like we're finally out of the storm.
It did last a little longer than we're used to, didn't it?

Fields.MenuText: It must've known you were on board.
The sea can be harsh.
I hardly noticed, honestly. Then again, I wasn't walking around in it the whole time.

Fields.DialogueText: Mhmmmm, I get it, very funny.
The storm wasn't that bad. I hardly saw any lightning.
I wasn't going to let the storm change my daily routine.
Do we have an ETA?
Actually, the port town should be in sight soon enough.
I'll keep an eye on the horizon, then.
Just don't forget to keep an eye out for any approaching Morganas, too.
Obviously. Actually, I think we might have company.
*ALARM*
Yup, we definitely have company.
Out of the storm and into the firefight.
Just the way I like it.
@BATTLE
Capitano, our destination is in sight.

Fields.MenuText: That's great.
That's horrible.
How's it look?

Fields.DialogueText: Not exactly, I think it's about to be under attack.
Did somebody already tell you?
Fortified. I think they're anticipating an attack.
I'm sensing several Morganas headed straight for them. If we don't hurry, I'm not sure how much of the town will be left when we get there.
Then we should hurry.
But not too fast.
Excuse me?
If we get there after they engage, we'll be able to flank them. We'll have the advantage.
You're right...  do you think the town will be able to handle a volley from that many Morganas?
With their fortifications, they should be fine. Don't worry, I've thought about this. We'll be able to take them down faster if they don't see us coming.
Okay, we'll hurry, stealthily.
@BATTLE
Tell me what? I just hate France.
You're our reinforcements?
Something like that.
I was expecting something more... well, more.
Well, we were able to take care of those Morganas off the coast pretty easily, weren't we?
Yes, well, that group was only a small fraction of the armada that has set their sights on us. They've sent twice that number before. We were lucky. All of us.

Fields.MenuText: Twice as many? That sounds... terrifying.
No matter the amount, Morganas don't scare us.
Still doubt us, huh? I guess they haven't heard the stories about you, Camicia.

Fields.DialogueText: The number doesn't matter. Not to me and my weapons, at least.
In fact, we scare Morganas.
I guess not. ... And I'd appreciate it if you kept those stories to yourself.
*BOOM*
Great, they're back. We appreciate that you're here to help, but we're needed in defense of the coast right now.
Very well. Know, though, that if you want to drive the Morganas away for good, we'll need to strategize together.
Maybe. But that can wait. You can come and join us, or wait in our harbor, but either way, we must go.
So, what do you think? Should we stay or join the battle?
The guns are already loaded.
@BATTLE
So that's your plan?
This is what we've come up with. Do you have something better?
Chasing down the next horde that attacks until they lead you to the rest of their Morgana compatriots is a suicide mission.
I'm sorry, I'll ask again! Do you have a better idea?
You misunderstand. I meant it's a suicide mission for you. You're not strong enough. They'd eat you alive.

Fields.MenuText: You're suggesting we do it?
You're suggesting they just sit here and take it?
You think we need to come up with a better plan?

Fields.DialogueText: Exactly. They're weak, we're not. It's that simple.
No. They won't be able to take these attacks much longer.
There's no need. We already have a plan.
We'll follow the next horde that slinks away from here with their tails between their legs. Then we'll make sure every last Morgana in their lair feels our fury.
Mademoiselle! We are far from weak. We're capable of facing these Morganas on our own.
Wouldn't you rather stay here to protect your home?
You'd have to at least let us send some of our men to join you.
I don't need your men. *spit* They wouldn't be able to keep up with me anyway.
Capitaine, you must allow us to handle these Morganas. They're our problem, we can defeat them.
Camicia won't work with you. So the way I see it, one of our forces will chase down the Morganas, and the other will stay here to defend the port.
You know where I belong, Capitano.
*ALARM*
I'll think about this, but right now, Captain, you need to get back to your ship. More Morganas are headed this direction.
I'll see you on the battlefield.
@BATTLE
*ALARM*
Another raid already?

Fields.MenuText: Too much for you?
I guess they're stepping up their game.
You know you love it.

Fields.DialogueText: Not yet, but I'll keep you updated.
They must realize they'll need to if they want to take me down.
Well, we're winning, so yes.
*BOOM*
Let's hurry.
@BATTLE
What's with that face?
The French ship started without us.
And that makes you angry?
I just don't enjoy the company of people like that. That capitano thinks he and his men are so strong. Yet without me, they'd all be dead by now.
You're right, you're the reason they're alive. Let's focus on that and make sure your gun stays aimed the Morganas.
*sigh*
Have you made a decision yet?
I made a decision as soon as he left. It wasn't hard.
So you agree with me? We should be the ones to chase down the Morganas?

Fields.MenuText: Better us than them.
With you, it would take one hundred Morganas to overwhelm us.
Is that excitement I hear in your voice?

Fields.DialogueText: Well, there is no one better at facing Morganas.
And even then, it would have to be one hundred Morganas with extra firepower.
Of course not. I knew you'd make the right decision.
Now, when do we leave?
Hold your horses. We still need to go over the plan with the French forces. If we're leaving, I don't want to come back to a smoking husk of what used to be a port.
That would put all our hard work to waste. Should we bring the capitano on board now, or...
*ALARM*
Or we can talk about it after we take care of another wave.
Sounds like we'll have to.
Seems they're coming in full force this time.
Good thing we're leaving soon.
@BATTLE
I assume, since you made me come all this way, you've come to a decision.
I have.
So you will stay here and guard in our stead while we defeat the Morgana force?
We'll be the ones destroying the Morganas. But feel free to wait here and bake us some croissants while you wait for us to come back.
Capitaine, if you can not control your wench, I'll--
Wench? You're really not endearing yourself or this stupid town to me. Maybe the Morganas have the right idea after all!
Of course you would side with Morganas. You and your kind are practically no better than them.
So you want me to kick your ass? That can be arranged.
All right, you two, just stop. We're supposed to be on the same side!
I...  *sigh*
You're right... but I'm not going to apologize.
Now what did you decide, Capitaine?
Camicia and I will follow the Morgana forces after their next attack, and you and your men will defend the town from any other attacks.
I would argue... but I'm sure that would get us nowhere.
Ah, the fool learns.

Fields.MenuText: This wasn't an easy decision.
We're the best bet your town has, Captain.
Have a little faith. We're stronger than we look.

Fields.DialogueText: It was for me. The capitano just overthinks things.
It's not really a bet when you already know the outcome.
And If you keep pissing me off, I might have to show you just how strong I am.
I'm trusting you. Both of you. I don't have any other choice.
As this war goes on, if you're lucky enough to survive, you'll look back on this moment as the best choice you made.
My men will be ready to defend the town while you're gone. Be prepared, the Morganas will no doubt strike soon.
We're always prepared.
@BATTLE
Morgana patrol sighted!
@BATTLE
They're turning tail, Capitano! Is it time to follow?

Fields.MenuText: No, wait and put some space between us.
Yes, don't let them get away!
What do you think?

Fields.DialogueText: Whatever you say...
Yes, Capitano. We'll stick to them like a shadow.
I think I'd rather be watching them sink to the bottom of the ocean.
... Okay, let's move. Keep them in our sights!
Relax, Capitano. The real fight hasn't even started yet. If you're already getting worked up now, I'd hate to see you up against a true horde.
I'll be fine. It's just a little stress.
I've got this. Go relax in your office for a bit.
I said I'll be fine.
And I said go!
Good grief...
There. We've opened range a little bit. Can we continue now?
Capitano? Time to stretch your legs. Want some coffee?
Camicia, have we arrived yet?
Not yet, I just thought I'd drop in and... well, thank you.

Fields.MenuText: Thank me?
You're welcome, now get back to tracking.
It's not really the best time, Camicia.

Fields.DialogueText: For what you did back there.
You don't even know why I'm thanking you yet.
Don't worry, I've got an eye on the Morganas. They won't get away.
It really means a lot that you trusted me with what might very well be a suicide mission.
A suicide mission for anyone else. Not for us. Right?
Exactly, I belong on the battlefield. There's no fight I can lose. Unbalanced or overwhelmed, no matter the odds, I'm the woman for the job.
Well, I'm glad you're so excited.
You don't get it, it's not just excitement.
If I had been stuck there, shackled to that town, waiting for the men to bring home the bacon while I was tucking in the kids and cleaning the house? It would have been torture!
You get that, don't you?!
Whoa, Camicia, calm down! It's all right! You're safe, here... in the middle of the... war...
War... right... phew. Sorry about that, Capitano. I'll just, uh...  I'll get back to tracking.
That... was interesting... I feel like she's having trouble holding something back.
I'm waiting, Camicia. Make your report.
We've found it.

Fields.MenuText: The Morgana hideout?
My left sock? I've been looking everywhere.
About time.

Fields.DialogueText: Obviously. What else would I be talking about?
Your what? Stop being foolish. I'm talking about the Morgana hideout.
Well, I guess Morganas are a lot slower after you've kicked their asses.
So should we head in now? Take care of all of them?
I think we should wait.
Why? They're all in there, just waiting for us to burst in and demolish the lot of them.
Do you know how many there are in there?
No.
Do you know the best time to attack?
Now?
No. All I'm saying is, it might be a good idea to scope them out for a little while before rushing in.
Ugh, I don't care. Just let me at them already!
Captain, we're picking up some Morganas headed our direction.
From the hideout?
No, from the opposite direction, actually.
Well, let's head that way. We don't want to draw too much attention from the hideout. Think this will be enough of a fight for now?
I guess we'll find out.
@BATTLE
Did you see her?
Did you hear her?
I knew it was coming.
You guys talking about Camicia?
Yeah, she's been pacing a ditch into the deck since we started watching this Morgana hideout.
Yeah, I heard her muttering some pretty graphic stuff under her breath.
I feel bad for those Morganas... kind of. I'm glad she's on our side.

Fields.MenuText: You and me both.
I just hope she'll be able to control herself until we're ready to attack.
Well, I hope she's not the only one ready to fight. What about you guys?

Fields.DialogueText: Yeah, if she sided with the Morganas, I'm pretty sure we'd all be dead.
I wouldn't bet on it, but she seems to listen to you more than she used to.
Don't worry about us, Captain. We might not be Camicia Nera, but we're ready.
*ALARM*
It's been a pleasure eating with you fellows, but it seems like we've been spotted again.
We really need to find a better hiding spot.
Yeah, well, I don't think we'll be hiding for much longer. We have an armada to fight, after all.
@BATTLE
Guess she's warming up to you, Captain.
Always.
I'd show you, but I've got mustard on my hands.
Camicia, I think we've seen enough. It's time to fight.
Thank God, I was this close to just charging in anyway. So, what's the plan?
Well, we're not charging in, first of all--
You just said! I swear if you're jerking me around, I'm going to skin you alive and make you into a holding pouch for my Tuaca.

Fields.MenuText: Holy shit, that really escalated.
Calm down, we're still going to fight, but not recklessly.
I used to find your outbursts scary, but now I just think they're cute.

Fields.DialogueText: *breathe* You're right... I'll let you speak before I pull out my carving knives.
Okay, that's all I wanted. Go ahead and tell me your plan.
Oh, yeah? Well, I think you'd make a really cute hand bag.
Well, the plan is pretty simple, we'll wait--
Ughhhhh.
We'll wait until the next squadron leaves to attack the port. Then we'll slide in and destroy what's left. Then we'll hurry back to port and finish them off there.
You really think the French crew can handle an attack by themselves?
You don't?
Not with that buffoon leading them. We might need to adjust the plan a little.
Go on.
When the squadron heads out, we attack them, then we move in and destroy the rest.
Wouldn't we risk drawing the rest of the forces out in the first fight?
Who do you think you're talking to? I'm the "Unseen Storm," remember?
@BATTLE
Flatterer.
Just shut up and talk already.
Huh...
You keep peering out at the horizon, but I know you're thinking about something else. What is it?
Just evaluating the Morganas. They're stronger than before. It's a good thing we intercepted them. Those French buffoons wouldn't have stood a chance.

Fields.MenuText: You sound a little scared.
You sound a little excited.
Can we hurry this up, "Unseen Storm?"

Fields.DialogueText: Scared? No, you must be confused, Capitano. Did you get into my Tuaca stash?
Maybe a little. After this we'll have to celebrate with something strong and delicious.
Not if you keep calling me that.
This is the last of this pack. Let's finish them off!
They're just an appetizer. If we can't handle them, we might as well crawl home to our mothers!
@BATTLE
How are we doing?
We're fine. This ship's taken worse.
Damn straight. This is nothing to us. Let's hurry on to the main course.
I hope we're not making a mistake.
Stop thinking like that. If you walk into a fight with thoughts like that, you won't be walking out of it.
So you're telling me to think happy thoughts?
Think confident thoughts. Just remember that you have me.
Tuaca?
What else?
I'd ask what that look on your face means, but I know that if I just wait--
So this is the Morgana horde I was promised?!

Fields.MenuText: Don't tell me you're disappointed. This cove is packed with Morganas.
Still confident? That's a whole lot of ugly.
We've got this. I just hope there will actually be croissants waiting for us when we get back.

Fields.DialogueText: Nah, I'm pretty satisfied. Only thing that could make this better is a freshly lit cigarette.
Soon enough, it'll be a whole lot of destruction.
Heh, I'm sure there will be. I just hope the capitano bakes better than he fights.
We've clearly attracted their attention.
That's what happens when you start a fight right outside their metaphorical door.
Are we going to die?
Don't make me shut you up. I can't die this early. We've still got a whole war ahead of us.
You're going to shut me up? Don't make me remind you who's captain again. I can say we're going to die as many times as I--
*Kisses Captain*
That's better. Now stay right there and let me handle these bastards.
*BOOM*
Everybody! Let's crack some hulls!
Hmmm...
@BATTLE
You have one of those.
Then it's perfect.
Capitano...
Focus, Camicia.
They're still coming! Everyone, keep your head in the fight! No time to rest!
*BOOM*

Fields.MenuText: We need to talk about that kiss.
We're winning, I can already tell.
Want to run?

Fields.DialogueText: Not the best time, Capitano. We're in the middle of dodging gunfire here!
That's a better attitude. It won't be long now before they're nothing but scrap!
Run? Don't make me kiss you again! I can go on like this for days!
Here they come!
@BATTLE
That's... all of them... right?
Yeah. I think we can finally breathe easy.
I really need a smoke right now.
You literally just lit one up.
Two is better than one.

Fields.MenuText: You're smoking two at once again? That's got to be a waste.
Speaking of two being better than one... is it time for another kiss?
Sometimes... one can be good, too.

Fields.DialogueText: Mmmmm, feels so good.
*laugh* Begging like a puppy now? Nice try, Capitano!
Give me two examples.
Let's just head back.
In victory!
Clever.
You did it? Well, I'm impressed. There must've been countless Morganas lying in wait for you.
Eh, we've handled worse. But I have to say, I'm disappointed. I was expecting freshly baked french pastries. Where are my pastries?

Fields.MenuText: You didn't really expect him to make you pastries, did you?
Easy, Camicia. We want to make friends, not enemies.
I could go for some croissants.

Fields.DialogueText: I suppose I shouldn't have gotten my hopes up. I doubt he has any real skills in the kitchen, anyway.
*sigh* I suppose you're right. Never mind the pastries..
Croissants sound great, but I'd die for a nice éclair right about now.
If you... really want some pastries, I'm sure we can acquire some for you. It just may take a while to rustle some up.
That'd be great, thank you.
You don't have to do that.
No, please, allow me. You've done so much for us, it's the least I can do.
Yeah, Capitano, let him. I worked up an appetite. Unfortunately, I need more than tuaca and cigarettes to survive.
*ALARM*
Okay, but it sounds like we have something to take care of first.
Fine, but Morganas leave a horrible taste in my mouth. We'd better get éclairs after.
I'll return to my vessel. Thank you both... we'd be dead without you.
Anytime. Despite Camicia's insults, we're allies. If you need us, we'll be there.
I'll remember that. Now, let's fight these Morganas. We need to reclaim some small part of our dignity.
@BATTLE
Hey, Camicia...
What is it? What's with the serious face?
I wanted to ask you something.
If you're going to ask for an éclair, the answer is no. These French desserts are far too small. I need all of them.

Fields.MenuText: Actually, I'm not in the mood for éclairs.
Actually, I was going to bring up the kiss. We should talk about that.
Seriously? All of them? If you're not careful, you're going to get fat.

Fields.DialogueText: Seriously? You've got to be joking. They go great with my Tuaca. What could be better?
Oh, that again? I'd rather give you an éclair.
That is the last thing you should say to a woman. At least if you want to get closer to her in the future.
Ugh, is this really something we need to talk about? Some things are better off just unsaid.
This isn't one of those things. I'd rather not be confused about it. I want to be happy about it.
Happy? Did I make you happy?
When you kissed me, I was speechless. I wanted to kiss you back, but the timing wasn't right.
